definition: to let go/to release
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to have free rein (idiom)

sentences.english: In the dark pines the wind disentangles itself.
sentences.chinese: 在松树的阴影下，风放开自己。

sentences.english: Seeds are open - minded, drink a heaven-sent "holy water."
sentences.chinese: 种子们放开胸怀，畅饮着天赐的“圣水”。

sentences.english: Let go hand in a noisy streets, find the pupil picture www. anhuiqq. cn.
sentences.chinese: 放开手在喧闹的大街，找不到瞳孔中的画面。

sentences.english: Release the Foot Switch when the Calibration Indicator reaches its set position.
sentences.chinese: 当刻度指示器指向规定的位置，放开脚踏板。

sentences.english: At this, he instantly let me go, and I ran for my life.
sentences.chinese: 听到这话，他立刻放开了我，我于是拼命逃跑。

sentences.english: Be open to growing in that direction. You owe it to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 请放开向梦想的方向成长吧，这归功于你自己。

sentences.english: Just let go and let yourself be in the moment.
sentences.chinese: 只是放开并让自己处在当下时刻。

sentences.english: Until the lane Mo jeans aloud of ask for forgiveness, he just release her.
sentences.chinese: 直到弄墨气喘吁吁的讨饶，他才放开她。

sentences.english: They threw their hands in the air.
sentences.chinese: 他们把手放开伸在空中。

sentences.english: Now the hall-boy pounded on the door and he released his hold upon her regretfully.
sentences.chinese: 这时旅馆的茶房把门敲得砰砰响，他遗憾地放开了她。

sentences.english: Ironically, letting go of what you want is the only way to get it.
sentences.chinese: 讽刺的是，放开你想要的是得到它的唯一方法。

sentences.english: Singest of summer in full-throated ease.
If this book is allowed to be published the floodgates will open.
sentences.chinese: 如果这本书被允许出版，水闸将被放开。

sentences.english: I give you, love, is the final release.
sentences.chinese: 我给你，最后的疼爱，是手放开。

sentences.english: Drag along an ice hockey with the mouse, the or so ambulation releases again a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 用鼠标拖住冰球，左右移动再放开鼠标。

sentences.english: Finally the love is a hand release, later, you are in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 最后的疼爱是手放开，以后，你在我心里。

definition: to untie/(fig.) to ease restrictions
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to let go one's hold/to give up/to have a free hand
to regain/to retake/to take back/to withdraw/to revoke
to bind/to restrict/to tie/to commit/fetters
to tighten/to contract/to shrink in
to loosen/to relax
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
misgivings/apprehensions
to restrict/to limit/to confine/restriction/limit/CL:個|个[ge4]
to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to catch up with/to keep pace with
to restrict/to limit to/to constrain/restriction/constraint
to shake off/to get rid of
to relinquish one's grip/to let go
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
